item.title: KrakenD Execution Flow
item.description: To truly master KrakenD, you should get familiar with the concept of “pipes” and how these pipes define the execution flow of KrakenD from request to response. A recurring question we hear from developers: Is the configuration X executed before the configuration Y?. If you are unfamiliar with KrakenD, it’s hard to tell, as the declaration order does not matter (with a few sequential exceptions). Instead, each piece acts in a specific part(s) of the request and response journey.
